meanings.definition: A person or thing that deforms.
meanings.sent1: The deformers in the movie were the villains who wanted to change the shape of everything.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor used various deformers to create unique shapes in the clay.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous deformers in the story kept bending all the spoons in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as deformers, twisting the truth into something unrecognizable.
meanings.sent5: The magical wand was like a deformer, reshaping reality with a wave.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used to deform something.
meanings.sent1: She used a hammer as a deformer to flatten the metal sheet.
meanings.sent2: The car mechanic had a set of deformers to adjust the bodywork.
meanings.sent3: The deformer in his toolbox was a special plier for bending wires.
meanings.sent4: The wind acted as a natural deformer, shaping the sand dunes over time.
meanings.sent5: The potter's wheel was a skilled deformer, turning clay into beautiful pottery.

meanings.sent1: The heat was the main deformer in the process, softening the plastic.
meanings.sent2: The chemical solution acted as a deformer, altering the structure of the material.
meanings.sent3: The prankster sprinkled a deformer powder on the chair, making it wobbly.
meanings.sent4: Time can be a powerful deformer, changing landscapes slowly but surely.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake was a sudden deformer, reshaping the land in an instant.
